ML_AA_NAMES.AA_NAME: Deutsche Gesellschaft für Internationale Zusammenarbeit (GIZ) GmbH

ADDRESS_CONTRACTING_BODY.OFFICIALNAME: Deutsche Gesellschaft für Internationale Zusammenarbeit (GIZ) GmbH

TITLE.P: 81221768 und 81221770 Consultancy services to support the implementation of the Thai-German Climate Programme

SHORT_DESCR.P: Deutsche Gesellschaft für Internationale Zusammenarbeit (GIZ) works in Thailand on behalf of the German Federal Ministry for the Environment, Nature Conservation, Building and Nuclear Safety (BMUB) since 2009. In the framework of the International Climate Initiative (IKI), GIZ supports the Thai Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment (MoNRE) to reduce its greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions and improve its adaptation to climate change.
GIZ is, therefore, seeking to procure high-quality consultancy services to support the Thai government to implement their Nationally Determined Contributions (NDCs) through two lots:
Lot 1: Domestic measurement, reporting and verification system (“MRV”) 81221768.
Lot 2: Strengthening institutional structures to mobilize financing for NDC implementation (“Climate Finance”) 81221770.

Under lot 1, the service provider is required to provide technical assistance to improve the existing domestic MRV system in accordance to current MRV and future transparency UNFCCC requirements and to improve the capacities in the sectors of renewable energy, agriculture/rice production, waste and water. The service provider shall also develop sectoral MRV systems in line with the overall Thai MRV system.
The following 3 tasks shall be performed:
- Task 1: Review and analysis of existing mechanisms/frameworks regarding collection and management of all data relevant to develop a national MRV system.
- Task 2: Design of the domestic MRV system.
- Task 3: Capacity development for involved actors.

Bidders are expected to propose 1 international team leader (up to 2500 expert months) and a pool of international short-term MRV experts (up to 6667 expert months). The detailed qualification criteria for these experts are stated only in the procurement documents.
Duration of the Contract: June 2018 until 31 December 2020.

CRITERIA_CANDIDATE.P: Economic and financial standing.
List and a brief description of selection criteria:
Average annual turnover for the last 3 financial years: 400 000.00 EUR.
Number of employees as on 31.12 of the previous year: at least 7.
Technical and professional ability.
List and a brief description of selection criteria:
The technical assessment is only based on reference projects with a minimum commission value of 150 000.00 EUR.
Minimum requirements:
— at least 6 reference projects in the technical fields MRV/GHG Inventory/Sector competence,
— at least 4 reference projects in the region South-East Asia in the last 3 years.
1) Technical experience 65 %
a) MRV system development.
b) Expertise in data collection in NDC relevant sectors (renewable energy, agriculture, waste).
c) Expertise on the monitoring of adaptation actions.
d) Understanding of UNFCCC negotiations.
2) Regional experience: South-East Asia 15 %;
3) Experience of development projects (ODA-financed) 20 %

SHORT_DESCR.P: Under lot 2, the service provider is required to analyse the climate finance landscape and climate finance needs in Thailand, develop a strategy to engage the private sector and to strengthen institutional structures in Thailand to facilitate and monitor climate finance, especially the access to funding from the Green Climate Fund (GCF).
The following 3 tasks shall be performed:
- Task 1: Overview of financing needs for NDC implementation.
- Task 2: Development of a strategy for private sector involvement.
- Task 3: Strengthening institutional structures to facilitate climate finance.

Bidders are expected to propose one international Team Leader (up to 3333 expert months), a pool of international short-term climate finance experts (up to 6667 expert months) and 1 international GCF accreditation expert (up to 1667 expert months). The detailed qualification criteria for these experts are stated only in the procurement documents.

CRITERIA_CANDIDATE.P: Economic and financial standing.
List and a brief description of selection criteria:
Average annual turnover for the last 3 financial years: 450 000.00 EUR.
Number of employees as on 31.12 of the previous year: at least 8.
Technical and professional ability.
List and a brief description of selection criteria:
The technical assessment is only based on reference projects with a minimum commission value of 150 000.00 EUR.
Minimum requirements:
— at least 6 reference projects in the technical fields climate finance, private sector involvement and GCF advisory,
— at least 4 reference projects in the region South-East Asia in the last 3 years.
1) Technical experience 65 %
a) Designing or implementing climate finance instruments (e.g. grant or loan schemes, regulatory/fiscal instruments, etc.);
b) Research and advisory in engaging the private sector in climate finance;
c) Advisory in accessing funding from international climate finance funds (such as the GCF);
d) Project preparation (e.g. feasibility studies) in specific sectors (renewable energy, energy efficiency, agriculture, waste, water).
2) Regional experience: South-East Asia 15 %;
3) Experience of development projects (ODA-financed) 20 %

SUITABILITY.P: Mandatory grounds for exclusion as per section 123 GWB.
Optional grounds for exclusion as per section 124 GWB.
In case of bidding consortia. Declaration by a consortium.

REVIEW_PROCEDURE.P: According to Article 160, Section 3 of the German Act Against Restraint of Competition, application for re-examination is not permissible insofar as.

1. The applicant has identified the claimed infringement of the contract award regulations before submitting the application for re-examination and has not submitted a complaint to the commissioning party within a period of 10 calendar days; the expiry of the period pursuant to Article 134, Section 2 remains unaffected,

2. Complaints of infringements of contract award regulations that are evident in the notice are not submitted to the commissioning party at the latest by the expiry of the deadline for the application specified in the notice or by the deadline for the submission of bids,

3. Complaints of infringements of contract award regulations that first become evident in the tender documents are not submitted to the commissioning party at the latest by the expiry of the deadline for application or for the submission of bids,
4. More than 15 calendar days have elapsed after receipt of the notification from the commissioning party that it is unwilling to redress the complaint.

Sentence 1 does not apply in the case of an application to determine the invalidity of the contract in accordance with Article 135, Section 1 (2). Article 134, Section 1, Sentence 2 remains unaffected.
